# Introduction


```{r setup}
library(filematch)
library(tidyverse)
# library(StatMatch)
# library(clue)
```

Create data for the A and B files.

```{r create_data}

# test on the same data I used in julia ----
adf <- read_delim("
ida weighta ranka
4 79.9297 0.045742
1 93.4751 0.410937
8 74.8385 0.518504
7 49.0379 0.624424
10 5.8328 0.630887
5 66.3594 0.729227
9 56.304 0.747482
2 11.9394 0.858867
6 67.1042 0.979532
3 21.3759 0.986625",
delim=" ", col_names = TRUE, trim_ws = TRUE)

bdf <- read_delim("
idb weightb rankb
5 32.3814 0.0658773
3 110.878 0.171634
2 117.388 0.219503
4 170.165 0.580475
1 95.3846 0.759547",
delim=" ", col_names = TRUE, trim_ws = TRUE)


```
Check the data and sort by the ranking variable

```{r check_data_and_sort}

# weights need to be approximately equal
sum(adf$weighta)
sum(bdf$weightb)

adf <- adf |> 
  arrange(desc(ranka))

bdf <- bdf |> 
  arrange(desc(rankb))

```

Match the records.

```{r match_recs}

ab <- matchrecs(adf, bdf)


```

```{r examine_results}
ab |>
  arrange(ida, desc(rankb))

# merge back against original files to get weighta and weightb

ab2 <- ab |> 
  left_join(adf |> 
              select(ida, weighta),
            join_by(ida)) |> 
  left_join(bdf |> 
              select(idb, weightb),
            join_by(idb)) |> 
  relocate(weighta, weightb, .after=idb) |> 
  arrange(ida, (desc(rankb)))

ab2

```
